Pre-Game Insights: Burkina Faso will head into their Matchday 2 encounter against Malawi as clear favorites, buoyed by a solid performance in their opening match where they earned a hard-fought draw against Senegal.
Burkina Faso’s defensive discipline and attacking threat were on full display against Senegal, and coach Brama Traore will likely deploy a similar strategy to exploit Malawi’s weaknesses.
Players like Dango Ouattara and Aziz Ki will look to lead the charge as Burkina Faso aim to secure their first victory of the campaign.
Malawi faces an uphill battle after their opening loss to Burundi and will need to regroup quickly to avoid falling further behind in the qualification race.
Despite their underdog status, Malawi has proven capable of surprises in the past and will be desperate to secure a positive result against Burkina Faso.
